meanings.definition: Sensory receptors that detect stimuli arising from within the body.
meanings.sent1: The interoceptors in our stomachs help us feel when we are hungry.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use interoceptors to monitor patients' heart rates and blood pressure.
meanings.sent3: The interoceptors in my body must be on vacation because I can't tell if I'm full or not!
meanings.sent4: Her intuition acted like interoceptors, warning her of the impending danger.
meanings.sent5: The interoceptors in his skin tingled as he walked into the cold water.

meanings.definition: Receptors that monitor internal bodily functions.
meanings.sent1: Interoceptors play a crucial role in regulating body temperature.
meanings.sent2: The interoceptors in the brain help maintain balance and coordination.
meanings.sent3: I wish my interoceptors could remind me to drink water throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: His interoceptors were like tiny guardians, always watching over his health.
meanings.sent5: The interoceptors in her lungs signaled the need for deeper breaths during exercise.
